server_costs.title: 服务器成本
server_costs.description: Hi, viddie here. Unsurprisingly, running servers costs money, and while I can pour in as much time as I like into creating this project, someone has to pay to keep the server running. This website does not (and will never) have ADs. I am willing to pay for the server costs all by myself if necessary, but if anyone in the community wants to help me out, I would gladly appreciate it!

costs_so_far.title: 截至目前服务器所用成本

info_boxes.author: 作者

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: This page exists mostly as a formalization of rules and edge cases for said rules. The long and short of it all is what you'd expect: Don't cheat, don't use gameplay-altering mods, all the like. However, if you are confused about if something may be allowed or want some recommendations for doing deathless challenges, please read the respective section.

rules.0: The map or map pack must be uploaded to GameBanana. If a map was previously on GameBanana but it was taken down afterwards, it will be uploaded to this archive.org item unless the map creator specifically requests to remove its downloadability.
rules.1: The map or map pack must pose a non-trivial amount of difficulty, even if that difficulty may be very small. Maps with little to no ways to die will be rejected.
rules.2: The map or map pack must be at least three gameplay screens or checkpoints in length. This matches the shortest c-sides in the vanilla game.
rules.3: The map or map pack must not contain NSFW content.
rules.4: The map or map pack is recommended to not resemble a base game map or an existing custom map to a high degree. Unique map packs such as Etselec or more thoughtful, usually more difficult edits such as Farewell^9 are acceptable, while maps such as 1a Undefined are likely to be rejected.
rules.5: The map or map pack is recommended to not be low-quality in nature. "Shitpost" or "meme" maps are fine, so long as there remains playable and generally-thought-out gameplay beneath it. Since this is vague, it's really decided more on a case by case basis, but if one would like a quick comparison: Maps like Shitpost Summit or The Decline are fine, but maps like frickyou are not.

rules.0: The submission video must be uploaded to a place that does not require "signing in" to view. The most popular sites for such videos are YouTube, Twitch, bilibili, and nicovideo, but sites outside of these are perfectly fine to be submitted. A messaging service CDN (i.e. cdn.discordapp.com or similar) is not accepted for submissions.
rules.1: The submission video must show the complete achievement of the challenge, e.g. from obtaining the golden strawberry to when the golden strawberry collects. It is not necessary that one must stay alive after the completion of the challenge but before exiting the map (e.g. "Heart Deaths"). Note that a golden strawberry collecting may not always be the end of a challenge, such as a berry remaining in a full clear challenge, as is the case for Anubi Full Clear. Exceptions to this are very rare and evaluated on a case-by-case basis, such as a livestream cutting out for a brief moment, so long as the circumstances and player are deemed trustworthy.
rules.2: Submissions must be done in one contiguous play session.
rules.3: Submissions must not make use of gameplay-altering mods, variants, or assist mode. Visual-altering mods and variants may be allowed on a case-by-case basis. See allowed and recommended mods for more details.
rules.4: Submissions for challenges as or more difficult than Tier 3 must have a recording of a full session. In the event that the submission was done near the beginning of the session, a request for a previous session recording may be asked.
rules.5: Submissions are recommended to not make use of "info mods" which give you information that you otherwise would not know during gameplay, such as input history, stamina bar, or CelesteTAS's info HUD. On challenges where these make little to no difference, submissions will be accepted without issue. On challenges where these may make some difference, but not enough to be exceedingly notable, submissions will be accepted, but with a note. On challenges where these make a big difference, such as subpixel-level alignment or stamina-heavy maps, submissions will likely be rejected.
rules.6: Submissions must not abuse the use of pause buffering to a degree that trivializes the difficulty of the challenge. Pause buffering can make tight inputs in a map extremely easy, and heavy use of it is grounds for rejection. Since this is vague, it's usually evaluated on a case-by-case basis, but for a quick comparison: Pause buffering this one wallbounce in Aquatic Underground is fine, whereas pause buffering I Wanna Atone the Flower Golden is grounds for rejection. Runs which use a non-rejectable amount of pause buffering will have a note placed on them.
rules.7: Submissions must not abuse the long wait spinner deload glitch. Submissions may utilize the technique known as spinner stunning due to its frame-perfect nature and general unviability for goldens. For more info on these techniques, check out this video.
rules.8: If a map does not have a golden strawberry, one is allowed to use the console command give_golden to give themselves a golden strawberry. This command must be used in the first room of the map. Alternatively, one may use Ahorn or Lönn to add a golden strawberry in the first room of the map.
rules.9: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, the submission does not have to actually collect the berry so long as the run follows the same challenge requirements (A.K.A. a deathless berryless run). Runs where a golden strawberry is fundamentally different than a non-golden, such as a golden room, will most likely not be accepted in this manner. While of course discouraged and we urge submissions to collect the applicable berry, we also understand that sometimes things happen and people unexpectedly fluke, and we don't want that to take away from anyone's achievement. Deathless berryless submissions will be given a note.
rules.10: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, submissions may edit the end of a map to add a golden collect trigger if and only if a golden collect trigger does not exist. If a crystal heart indicates the ending but doesn't kick the player out, editing it to kick the player out is fine. This will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, as this is very rare.
rules.11: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, submissions are allowed to die during map intentional golden strawberry detachments as many times as one would like. This does not apply to golden detachments made to fix an issue (such as in A Beautiful Meadow) or unintentional golden detachments.

full_game_additional.header: Additional Rules for Full Game Submissions
full_game_additional.explanation: There are two types of "full game" submissions: ones that complete a relevant subset of all maps in a map pack (which will be referred to as partial full game runs), such as all c-sides deathless or beginner lobby deathless, and completely full game runs, such as all maps deathless or 100% deathless (which will be referred to as complete full game runs). Rules which apply to only a specific category of these will be indicated.
full_game_additional.0: The submission video must show the run in full. For a partial full game run, the video must start at or before the chapter select screen of the first map completed and end after completing the final map. For a complete full game run, the video must start at or before the file select screen and end after completing the final map.
full_game_additional.1: Submissions for complete full game runs must complete the maps as how they would be completed from a new save file. It is recommended to always use a new save file for complete full game runs and not use cheat mode as a result. Partial full game runs may complete the applicable maps in any order.
full_game_additional.2: Submissions must not use "Return to Map" or any similar option to cheat likely death or otherwise make a map easier. This includes instances where one is "softlocked" in a map by any means brought on by the player.
full_game_additional.3: Submissions must not utilize more than one save file.
full_game_additional.4: If the run has forced deaths (e.g. a Farewell-esque moon berry), runs are allowed to die in such instances, but no more than the minimum required to pass the section. Compare this to the previous note about individual level detachments
full_game_additional.5: Submissions must have the "File Timer" enabled, not just the chapter timer.
full_game_additional.6: Submissions must not have an overlay covering a large amount or essential parts of the screen. Essential parts include the timer, the total berry count in the top left, the pause menu berry tracker, the player, and the save icon in the bottom right.
full_game_additional.7: Submissions are recommended to not take long breaks on the menu or pause screen. It is more acceptable to take breaks while inside a map and not paused, though taking frequent breaks might raise suspicion and request for more proof.
full_game_additional.8: If a submission does not collect golden/silver berries, it may be submitted for individual map runs on the respective sheet if the challenge follows the same aforementioned rule about deathless berryless runs.

section.explanation: These aren't exactly rules that need to be followed, but they help in aiding proof strength, avoiding giving your submission a note, helping one complete a challenge, or is a general courteous decision for others.
section.0: Using the chapter or file timer will help credibility, but it is not required for single-map submissions. Recall that file timer is required for full game submissions.
section.1: Using an external input display, such as <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/ThoNohT/NohBoard">NohBoard</CustomExternalLink> for Windows, <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/yoshiyoshyosh/kbdisplay">kbdisplay</CustomExternalLink> for Linux (X11), or <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/RoanH/KeysPerSecond">KeysPerSecond</CustomExternalLink> for cross-platform, will help credibility.
section.2: For video compilations with multiple maps, adding timestamps in the description of the video or directly in the submission URL will help greatly.
section.3: Keep one or two full session runs on hand, especially for high tier goldens, in the event that a verifier requests more proof.

0.question: 我可以提交不在数据库里的地图吗？
0.answer: 可以，但你需要提供地图链接以确保它符合基本规则，但即便如此，我们也可能不会添加它，在这种情况下你可以查看已拒绝的地图页面以了解原因。

1.question: 地图至少要多难才能被添加？
1.answer: 很模糊的界限，看地图规则，也可以参考其他地图。

2.question: 如果地图上没有金草莓怎么办？
2.answer: 在打开调试模式的前提下按~然后输入give_golden，或者你可以在制图器（Ahorn或者Loenn）来添加金草莓，确保金草莓靠近复活点而且不会挡路就行。

3.question: 为什么有些地图难度比规则要求的要简单
3.answer: 特殊情况下，一些不符合难度的地图会经过团队决定后添加它们。比如一张地图虽然少于两面，但它是合集的一部分，不可分割（比如egc的五云，酱四的逆旅）。

4.question: Are demodash buttons/multiple jump binds allowed?
4.answer: Demodash buttons and multiple jump binds are allowed. The same goes for any combination of inputs that can be mapped on the same key/button, but external macros which press multiple inputs on different frames are not allowed.

5.question: Are pause buffers allowed?
5.answer: For pause buffers, you can pause the game but if pause was used too aggressively or distinctly used to frame advance (pause/unpause to progress frame by frame), a note may be put into the cell with the golden clear. A run that abuses pause buffering too much might get rejected.

6.question: What about spinner stunning?
6.answer: Due to its difficulty and lack of golden viability, spinner stunning is allowed (pausing frame perfectly multiple times to keep spinners/lightning unloaded). However, deloading spinners by waiting 118+ hours is not allowed.

7.question: FC的标准是什么？
7.answer: -（此条回答已过时，等待重写中）

8.question: Why are some maps ineligible for full clear runs?
8.answer: Some maps have collectibles which are not optional, such as strawberries in Hell Gym. For other maps, the collectibles do not add any extra challenge to the run, and therefore collecting them in a full clear run is not considered to be different from a standard run. For example, the moon berry in Path of D-espair or the cassette in Void Side.

9.question: What is the Top Golden List Rankings?
9.answer: The Top Golden List Rankings is a list of the hardest golden strawberry clears, where the minimum requirement to get on the list is to be harder than 'Hell Trio' from vanilla, which are the B-Side golden strawberries of chapters 6, 7, and 8. These are ordered by tier, so each color represents a different tier, and the higher up on the list means the harder it is. Please note that these are all decided subjectively by people with experience on the goldens, so these won't be perfectly accurate, and shouldn't be treated as such. The fewer people with the golden the more possible variance there is, so less popular goldens are more likely to be more inaccurate. It's intended to be our best estimate based on what the people who have done the goldens so far have said, so they're subject to change if and when more people do them. People generally try to base off a few things: their total playtime/experience with the game at the time of the golden, how much time they took on the map individually, and a more subjective analysis of the map's length, difficulty distribution, and gameplay consistency, among other things.
